main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by approximately 50 people in Center Sandwich, New Hampshire on 23 March 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as cigar-shaped or torpedo-shaped and whitish with an iridescent sheen., Estimated size of the object was comparable to that of a bomber aircraft., The object traveled at an estimated speed of 700 to 800 miles per hour., Witnesses observed the object at an altitude between 15,000 to 20,000 feet for about 20 minutes., Some witnesses claimed a second object joined the first momentarily before both disappeared.
witness description: Observers included local residents and a retired USAF Major.
